text.0: 1/3 Vaccines contain weakened or inactive parts of an antigen that triggers this immune response within the body. This means that if the person is exposed to the dangerous pathogen in the future, their immune system will be able to respond immediately, protecting against disease.
text.1:
Antigens in vaccines will not cause the disease in the person receiving the vaccine, but it will prompt their immune system to respond much as it would have on its first reaction to the actual pathogen.
#VaccinesWork https://t.co/5JKK9uIeJ8
text.2: Vaccines also contain other ingredients to keep the vaccine safe and effective. These ingredients are included in most vaccines and have been used for decades in billions of doses of vaccine. Each ingredient is tested in the manufacturing process and tested rigorously for safety. https://t.co/k6vZdQidJP
text.3: Vaccines contain weakened or inactive parts of an antigen that triggers this immune response within the body. This means that if the person is exposed to the dangerous pathogen in the future, their immune system will be able to respond immediately, protecting against disease. :backhand_index_pointing_down:
